definition: value/(to be) worth/to happen to/to be on duty
to link/to join/to connect/continuously/in succession/including/(used with 也[ye3], 都[dou1] etc) even/company (military)

sentences.english: One suet-jade may costs thousands of money or even priceless.
sentences.chinese: 一块羊脂白玉的价值动辄成千上万，甚至价值连城。

sentences.english: This can be valuable for many reasons.
sentences.chinese: 有许多理由可以说明这个是价值连城的。

sentences.english: As a simple system for content management, blogs are invaluable.
sentences.chinese: 作为信息管理的一个简单系统，博客价值连城。

sentences.english: A good recommendation engine is worth a lot of money.
sentences.chinese: 优秀的推荐引擎可谓价值连城。

sentences.english: The princess consort is wearing an invaluable necklace during the celebration.
sentences.chinese: 庆典时，王妃脖子里戴着价值连城的璎珞。

sentences.english: A maniac had gouged several holes in the priceless painting.
sentences.chinese: 有个狂徒在那幅价值连城的画上乱凿了几个洞。

sentences.english: Valuable amounts of minerals exist on the ocean floor, ready to be mined.
sentences.chinese: 价值连城的矿物存在于海底，等着被发掘。

sentences.english: That painting must be worth a king's ransom .
The second piece is emerald ring, it's very valuable.
sentences.chinese: 第二件是一个绿宝石戒指，价值连城。

sentences.english: It is a barain hunter who discovered the priceless violin.
sentences.chinese: 是一个搜罗便宜货的人发现了那把价值连城的小提琴。

sentences.english: It is said that the jade bracelet the princess consort wears is invaluable.
sentences.chinese: 据说王妃手上佩戴的玉镯是价值连城的宝物。

definition: best quality/item of the highest quality/(slang) outrageous/annoying in the extreme/gross/person with these qualities
precious mineral deposits/hidden treasure/(fig.) treasure/(Buddhism) the treasure of Buddha's law
